intro: Sterculia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain angular, chestnut-like seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
